name: Djinguereber Mosque
description: A world-renowned center of learning and a UNESCO World Heritage site, built in the 14th century with traditional mudbrick architecture.

name: Sankore Madrasah
description: Historically, one of the three ancient universities located in Timbuktu, the Sankore Mosque was a vital center of Islamic scholarship and learning.

name: House of Explorer René Caillié
description: This is the house where the French explorer René Caillié, one of the first Europeans to return from Timbuktu, stayed in 1828.

name: Manuscript Libraries
description: Timbuktu is home to a vast collection of ancient manuscripts, many dating back to the 13th century, covering a wide range of topics from astronomy to law.

name: Camel Market
description: A bustling hub of commerce where locals and traders from across the Sahara gather to trade goods, including the iconic Timbuktu camels.

name: Sahara Desert
description: The city sits on the edge of the vast Sahara Desert, offering stunning landscapes, star gazing, and the gateway to ancient trade routes.

name: Market Square
description: The central square of the city, where daily life unfolds. It is a great place to observe local culture and find unique crafts and goods.

name: Timbuktu Museum
description: A museum dedicated to the history and culture of Timbuktu, housing artifacts and exhibits that tell the story of the city's golden age.
